page.title: 19ECOLOGY IN L.STAUGHTON
page.content: Modern large scale farming methods need fairly large fields,and consequently there have been some {hedges}removed in the area. However, many trees have lately been planted in inaccessible field corners and along roadsides, country pursuits such as{pheasant and partridge shooting have undoubtedly encouraged the preservation of wild life. Good quality land coming on to the market could be expected to fetch around 7,000 pounds a hectare. The area contains two Grain Intervention Stores where surplus grain is kept under the{European {Economic Community Common Agricultural Policy. The larger store holds 17,000 tonnes and the smaller store holds 10,500 tonnes.
